---
title: 'Template System'
description: 'Customize your documentation output using Liquid templates'
---

# Template System

The Mintlify-TSdocs template system allows you to **fully customize** how your API documentation is generated using [Liquid](https://shopify.github.io/liquid/) templates. You can override individual templates or create your own template directory.

## Quick Start

### Initialize Templates

First, create a template directory with default templates:

```bash
mintlify-tsdocs init-templates --template-dir ./my-templates
```

### Use Custom Templates

```typescript
import { MarkdownDocumenter } from 'mintlify-tsdocs';

const documenter = new MarkdownDocumenter({
  apiModel: apiModel,
  outputFolder: './docs',
  templates: {
    // Use custom templates from a directory
    userTemplateDir: './my-templates',

    // Or override specific templates
    overrides: {
      class: './templates/custom-class.liquid',
      interface: './templates/custom-interface.liquid'
    },

    // Performance options
    cache: true,
    strict: true
  }
});

await documenter.generateFiles();
```

## Template Hierarchy

Templates are resolved in this priority order:

1. **Individual overrides** (`templates.overrides`) - Highest priority
2. **User template directory** (`templates.userTemplateDir`) - User templates override defaults
3. **Default templates** - Fallback when no user templates exist

### Template Merging System

The template system uses a **temporary merged directory** approach:

1. **Default templates** are copied to a temporary directory
2. **User templates** are merged in, overriding defaults when filenames match
3. **Liquid engine** uses the merged directory as its root
4. **Cleanup** happens automatically after documentation generation

This approach ensures:
- Users can override individual templates without affecting others
- The base layout system remains intact
- Template inheritance works correctly
- No conflicts between user and default templates

## Available Templates

| Template | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `layout.liquid` | Main page layout with frontmatter, breadcrumbs, warnings, and structure |
| `class.liquid` | Class documentation with constructors, properties, methods, events |
| `interface.liquid` | Interface documentation with properties, methods, events |
| `function.liquid` | Function documentation with parameters and return type |
| `method.liquid` | Method documentation with parameters and return type |
| `enum.liquid` | Enum documentation with members |
| `package.liquid` | Package overview with all contained items |
| `generic.liquid` | Fallback template for simple items |

## Template Data Structure

Each template receives a `data` object with semantic variables:

```liquid
# API Item metadata
{{ apiItem.name }}           # Item name
{{ apiItem.kind }}           # Item type (Class, Interface, etc.)
{{ apiItem.displayName }}    # Display name
{{ apiItem.description }}    # Description from TSDoc
{{ apiItem.summary }}        # Summary from TSDoc
{{ apiItem.remarks }}        # Remarks from TSDoc
{{ apiItem.signature }}      # TypeScript signature
{{ apiItem.isDeprecated }}   # Boolean
{{ apiItem.isAlpha }}        # Boolean
{{ apiItem.isBeta }}         # Boolean
{{ apiItem.releaseTag }}     # Release tag (Alpha, Beta, etc.)

# Page metadata
{{ page.title }}             # Page title
{{ page.description }}       # Page description
{{ page.icon }}              # Icon for navigation
{{ page.breadcrumb }}        # Array of breadcrumb items

# Semantic data arrays (direct access, no 'tables' wrapper)
{{ constructors }}           # Array of constructor items
{{ properties }}             # Array of property items
{{ methods }}                # Array of method items
{{ events }}                 # Array of event items
{{ parameters }}             # Array of parameter items
{{ returnType }}             # Return type object (not an array)
{{ members }}                # Array of enum members
{{ classes }}                # Array of class items (in packages)
{{ interfaces }}             # Array of interface items (in packages)
{{ functions }}              # Array of function items (in packages)
{{ enumerations }}           # Array of enum items (in packages)
{{ typeAliases }}            # Array of type alias items (in packages)
{{ namespaces }}             # Array of namespace items (in packages)
{{ variables }}              # Array of variable items (in packages)
{{ abstractClasses }}        # Array of abstract class items (in packages)

# Additional data
{{ examples }}               # Array of example strings
{{ heritageTypes }}          # Array of inheritance info
```

## Item Structure

Each item in the arrays has this structure:

```liquid
{% raw %}
{% for property in properties %}
### {{ property.title }}

{% if property.modifiers and property.modifiers.size > 0 %}
**Modifiers**: {{ property.modifiers | join: ', ' }}
{% endif %}

{% if property.type %}
**Type**: {% if property.typePath %}[{{ property.type }}]({{ property.typePath }}){% else %}{{ property.type }}{% endif %}
{% endif %}

{% if property.isOptional %}
**Optional**: Yes
{% endif %}

{% if property.isInherited %}
**Inherited**: Yes
{% endif %}

{% if property.defaultValue %}
**Default**: `{{ property.defaultValue }}`
{% endif %}

{% if property.description %}
{{ property.description }}
{% endif %}
{% endfor %}
{% endraw %}
```

## Template Structure

Templates use LiquidJS's `{% layout %}` tag with `{% block %}` inheritance:

```liquid
{% layout "layout" %}

{% block content %}
## Your Content Here
{% endblock %}
```

### Layout Template

The `layout.liquid` template defines blocks that child templates can override:

**Available Blocks:**
- `breadcrumb` - Breadcrumb navigation (has default content)
- `warnings` - Deprecation/alpha/beta warnings (has default content)
- `summary` - Summary section (has default content)
- `signature` - TypeScript signature (has default content)
- `heritage` - Inheritance/heritage info (has default content)
- `content` - Main body content (empty by default - **child templates fill this**)
- `remarks` - Remarks section (has default content)
- `examples` - Code examples (has default content)

**Frontmatter:**
- Title, icon, and description are automatically added from `page` data

### Variable Scope

With LiquidJS layouts, **all variables are automatically available** from child to parent:
- Child templates have access to all template data (`apiItem`, `page`, `properties`, etc.)
- Layout has access to the same variables
- **No need to pass variables explicitly!**

```liquid
{% layout "layout" %}

{% block content %}
## Properties

{% for property in properties %}
### {{ property.title }}
{{ property.description }}
{% endfor %}
{% endblock %}
```

### Customizing Blocks

Child templates can selectively override blocks. Unspecified blocks use the layout's default content:

```liquid
{% layout "layout" %}

{% block warnings %}
{# Custom warning logic #}
{% if apiItem.isExperimental %}
<Warning>Experimental API</Warning>
{% endif %}
{% endblock %}

{% block content %}
{# Your main content #}
{% endblock %}
```

## Liquid Features

Our Liquid implementation includes these custom filters:

| Filter | Description | Example |
|--------|-------------|---------|
| `kebab_case` | Convert to kebab-case | `{{ "MyClass" \| kebab_case }}` â†’ `my-class` |
| `snake_case` | Convert to snake_case | `{{ "MyClass" \| snake_case }}` â†’ `my_class` |
| `title_case` | Convert to Title Case | `{{ "myClass" \| title_case }}` â†’ `My Class` |
| `pluralize` | Simple pluralization | `{{ "item" \| pluralize: 2 }}` â†’ `items` |
| `truncate` | Truncate text | `{{ text \| truncate: 50 }}` â†’ `First 50 chars...` |

## Examples

### Override a Single Template

```typescript
const documenter = new MarkdownDocumenter({
  apiModel: apiModel,
  outputFolder: './docs',
  templates: {
    overrides: {
      class: './templates/my-custom-class.liquid'
    }
  }
});
```

### Custom Class Template

Create `templates/custom-class.liquid`:

```liquid
{% layout "layout" %}

{% block content %}
## ðŸ—ï¸ Constructors

{% if constructors and constructors.size > 0 %}
{% for constructor in constructors %}
### {{ constructor.title }}

{% if constructor.description %}
{{ constructor.description }}
{% endif %}

{% endfor %}
{% else %}
*No constructors defined.*
{% endif %}

## ðŸ“ Properties

{% if properties and properties.size > 0 %}
{% for property in properties %}
#### {{ property.title }}

{% if property.type %}
**Type**: `{{ property.type }}`
{% endif %}

{% if property.description %}
{{ property.description }}
{% endif %}

---
{% endfor %}
{% endif %}
{% endblock %}
```

### Using Filters

```liquid
## {{ apiItem.displayName | title_case }}

This {{ apiItem.kind | downcase }} has {{ methods.size }} methods.

{% if apiItem.description.size > 100 %}
{{ apiItem.description | truncate: 100 }}
{% else %}
{{ apiItem.description }}
{% endif %}
```

## Migration from EJS

If you were using EJS templates, here's how to migrate to Liquid:

### EJS â†’ Liquid Syntax

| EJS | Liquid | Notes |
|-----|--------|-------|
| `\u003c%= variable %\u003e` | `{{ variable }}` | Output variable |
| `\u003c% if (condition) { %\u003e` | `{% if condition %}` | Conditional |
| `\u003c% for (item of items) { %\u003e` | `{% for item in items %}` | Loop |
| `\u003c%= items.join(', ') %\u003e` | `{{ items | join: ', ' }}` | Array join |
| `\u003c% } %\u003e` | `{% endfor %}` | End loop |
| `\u003c% } %\u003e` | `{% endif %}` | End conditional |

### Complex Logic Migration

**EJS:**
```ejs
\u003c% if (properties && properties.length > 0) { %\u003e
\u003c% properties.forEach(property => { %\u003e
### \u003c%= property.title %\u003e
\u003c% if (property.modifiers && property.modifiers.length > 0) { %\u003e
**Modifiers**: \u003c%= property.modifiers.join(', ') %\u003e
\u003c% } %\u003e
\u003c% }); %\u003e
\u003c% } %\u003e
```

**Liquid:**
```liquid
{% if properties and properties.size > 0 %}
{% for property in properties %}
### {{ property.title }}
{% if property.modifiers and property.modifiers.size > 0 %}
**Modifiers**: {{ property.modifiers | join: ', ' }}
{% endif %}
{% endfor %}
{% endif %}
```

## Template Debugging

Enable template debugging:

```typescript
const documenter = new MarkdownDocumenter({
  // ... other options
  templates: {
    strict: true, // Will throw errors for undefined variables
    cache: false  // Disable caching for development
  }
});

// Get template statistics
const stats = documenter.templateManager.getTemplateStats();
console.log('Available templates:', stats.availableTemplates);
console.log('Overrides:', stats.overrides);
```

## Best Practices

1. **Start with defaults**: Copy a default template and modify it
2. **Use includes**: Create reusable components with Liquid includes
3. **Test incrementally**: Override one template at a time
4. **Version control**: Keep templates in your repository
5. **Document changes**: Add comments explaining custom logic
6. **Use filters**: Leverage built-in and custom Liquid filters
7. **Handle edge cases**: Always check if data exists before using it

## Security

- Templates are **sandboxed** and cannot access Node.js APIs
- All user input is **sanitized** to prevent XSS
- Dangerous Liquid features are **disabled** by default
- Template compilation errors are **caught and reported**

## Performance

- **Template caching** is enabled by default
- **Compiled templates** are reused across renders
- **Data sanitization** is optimized for large APIs
- **Async rendering** supports non-blocking I/O

For more Liquid syntax, see the [official Liquid documentation](https://shopify.github.io/liquid/).
